page.title: 02HINXHILL ESTATE FARM 1
page.content: Hinxhill Estate Farm covers a total area of 640 hectares.100 hectares of this land is not farmed due to the position of marsh,woodland and an area of peat bog which is situated through a part of the farm.The land running through Hinxhill Farm is varied. It is made up of gault clay,greensand, chalk and the peat which is 6m in places.This peat can be treated and fenced off but it is more economical to just let grass cover it. The strip of peat soil is very acidic and the wooden fence posts would be destroyed in a very short time. It was considered that it could be cut up and used for fuel purposes but again it is not economical to do so. In the last 20 years the size of the average field has greatly increased. This is due to hedgerows being torn up to make way for the entry of large machinery.
